Abrams Battle TankYou can often get the correct reading from the Commanding Officer's Check Damage screen

Abrams Battle TankThey don't prevent engine damage from overheating, either.

Alien 3Codes 1 to 38 work on all difficulty modes.
Alien 3D2CT-CADYGame clock runs faster
Alien 3SACT-CADYGame clock runs slower
Alien 38ACT-CADYGame clock runs much slower
Alien 3AACT-CA6JGame clock frozen (no time limit)
Alien 3AJBT-AAEYStart at stage 2 instead of stage 1
Alien 3ANBT-AAEYStart at stage 3
Alien 3ATBT-AAEYStart at guardian level after stage 3
Alien 3AYBT-AAEYStart at stage 4
Alien 3A2BT-AAEYStart at stage 5

BatmanCode 22 will make Batman invincible after he is hit once. Then he'll turn invisible. Normal game play is possible, but watch out for jumps. To make Batman visible, momentarily turn off effects and Batman may appear. If not, try again.

Dragon's FuryWith Codes 13 thru 26, the bonus multiplier will reset to 1 and bonus points will reset to 100 after the first bonus (unless you also use Codes 27 and 28). And remember that in a 2-player game the players share the bonus; if it is not collected  by one player, the current bonus values are available for the other player to collect.

Insector XDon't combine Codes 26 thru 29--when shot power goes above 6, the game will freeze.
Insector XSFYT-BNT0Each P worth 3 (half) shot power
Insector XSFYT-B2T0Each P worth 6 (full) shot power
Insector XSFYT-BJT0Each P worth 2 & each PP worth 3 shot power  
Insector XSFYA-B218Each PP worth 6 (full) shot power
Insector XTips: The game plays to your level.
Insector XIf you have a lot of shot power, the enemies will be harder to kill. 
Insector XIn some cases, it's better to have LESS shot power, because the enemies will go easier on you! 
Insector XAlso, the speed codes have the greatest effect on difficulty, not the shot power codes.

John Madden Football ('91)RH9A-R6V2MASTER CODE--MUST BE ENTERED
John Madden Football ('91)Codes 2 thru 5 may cause delays in plays and kick-offs.
John Madden Football ('91)B8KA-AADGRandom time on play clock
John Madden Football ('91)D4KA-AADGRandom time on play clock
John Madden Football ('91)With codes 4 and 5, the computer will run down the play clock - best to use in 2-Player mode.
John Madden Football ('91)HWKA-AADGPlay clock starts at 60 seconds
John Madden Football ('91)MLKA-AADGPlay clock starts at 90 seconds
John Madden Football ('91)Codes 6 thru 11 replace the 5-minute-per-quarter option in the options screen. It will still display the 5-minute quarter even though a code has been used to change this. The 15-minute quarter option works as normal.
John Madden Football ('91)D2XT-CADLEach quarter lasts 30 seconds
John Madden Football ('91)HTXT-CADLEach quarter lasts 1 minute
John Madden Football ('91)SAXT-CADLEach quarter lasts 2 minutes
John Madden Football ('91)MAXT-CEDLEach quarter lasts 10 minutes
John Madden Football ('91)NAXT-CJDLEach quarter lasts 18:20
John Madden Football ('91)BAXT-CRDLEach quarter lasts 30 minutes
John Madden Football ('91)AB4A-AAGEHome team starts with 0 timeouts
John Madden Football ('91)AF4A-AAGEHome team starts with 1 timeout
John Madden Football ('91)AK4A-AAGEHome team starts with 2 timeouts
John Madden Football ('91)AZ4A-AAGEHome team starts with 5 timeouts
John Madden Football ('91)BF4A-AAGEHome team starts with 9 timeouts
John Madden Football ('91)AB4A-AAGLVisiting team starts with 0 timeouts

King's Bounty2AXT-DCTGNever lose control of an army
King's BountyEarly in a game, it doesn't take many troops before an army gets too large to control. When using Code 164, you will still see the number of available troops decrease as you recruit them. However, if you leave the troop dwelling and re-enter it later, you will see that the original number of troops in the dwelling has been restored.

King's BountyIf the game won't accept a password from a game when you used codes try Code 168. However, if you had too many of something (for example 5,000 days left), the game may reduce the number for you.

Micro MachinesCodes 15 Thru 17 only work after the initial qualifying race.
Micro MachinesAEFT-AAH4You qualify for next race only if you win
Micro MachinesANFT-AAH4You qualify for next race if you get 3rd or better
Micro MachinesATFT-AAH4You always qualify for next race
Micro MachinesAEGT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 1 race
Micro MachinesAJGT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 2 races
Micro MachinesATGT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 5 races
Micro MachinesAYGT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 6 races
Micro MachinesA6GT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 8 races
Micro MachinesBJGT-AAC8You get to time trial every time you win 11 races

Micro MachinesABYA-BBFC + JBYA-AE0C90 seconds to get through Ruff Trux time trial

Micro MachinesABYA-BAPC + JBYA-AE0C30 seconds to get through Ruff Trux time trial
Micro MachinesABYA-AAPC + JBYA-AE0C20 seconds to get through Ruff Trux time trial
Micro MachinesWith Codes 30 Thru 33, the extra lives will not show, but you will have them!

Micro MachinesSAHA-BYXWWinning Ruff Trux time trial worth 5 extra lives

Mortal KombatA2JT-DA9WAlways fight in the Courtyard
Mortal KombatCodes 8 Thru 12 only work after the 1st round.

Mortal KombatAJJT-DA9WMost fights are in the Warrior Shrine
Mortal KombatANJT-DA9WMost fights are in the Pit
Mortal KombatATJT-DA9WMost fights are in the Throne Room
Mortal KombatAYJT-DA9WMost fights are in Goro's Lair

Ms. Pac-ManAJNA-AA30Infinite lives for Ms. Pac Man
Ms. Pac-ManAEEA-AACAMs. Pac Man starts with 1 life
Ms. Pac-ManBEEA-AACAMs. Pac Man starts with 9 lives
Ms. Pac-ManAJNA-AA4JInfinite lives for Pac Man
Ms. Pac-ManBEEA-AACGPac Man starts with 9 lives
Ms. Pac-ManAEEA-AACGPac Man starts with 1 life
Ms. Pac-Man4JNA-BACLWhen Pac Man gets hit, Ms. Pac Man loses a life instead
Ms. Pac-Man5JNA-BAB2When Ms. Pac Man gets hit, Pac Man loses a life instead
Ms. Pac-Man2CWA-CAGNGhosts stay blue 1/2x as long as normal--most of the time

Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumNWFC-YAGWChaz starts a new game with 100 HP (instead of only 25).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the Millenium9LFC-YAGWChaz starts a new game with 250 HP (instead of only 25).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the Millenium8WFC-YCGWChaz starts a new game with 500 HP (instead of only 25).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumGLFC-YAGYChaz starts a new game with 50 TP (instead of only 10).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumNRFC-YAGYChaz starts a new game with 99 TP (instead of only 10).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumD4FC-YTR0Chaz starts a new game with 40 Strength (instead of only 8), and 30 Mental  (instead of only 6). This code also causes your ATK Power to go up.
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumHWFC-ZA00Chaz starts a new game with 80 Strength (instead of only 8), and 60 Mental (instead of only 6). This code also causes your ATK Power to go up.
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumDGFC-YGR2Chaz starts a new game with 35 Agility (instead of only 7), and 25 Dexterity (instead of only 5). This code also causes your DFS Power to go up.
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumGLFC-YN02Chaz starts a new game with 70 Agility (instead of only 7), and 50 Dexterity (instead of only 5). This code also causes your DFS Power to go up.
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumACFC-ZEHJChaz starts a new game with the Titanium Sword equipped (instead of the Hunting Knives).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumACFC-Y49JChaz starts a new game with the Guard Sword equipped (instead of the Hunting Knives).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumACFC-ZR9JChaz starts a new game with the Elsydeon equipped (instead of the Hunting Knives).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumGGFC-ZWHLChaz starts a new game with the Titanium Helmet and the Ceramic Armor equipped (instead of the Leather Helmet and the Leather Cloth).
Phantasy Star 4 - The End of the MilleniumR0FC-YW1LChaz starts a new game with the Silver Helmet and the1Guard Mail equipped (instead of the Leather Helmet and the Leather Cloth).

RBI Baseball 3With Codes 28 and 29, unrestricted substitution means that a player who is taken out of the lineup may re-enter the game later.
RBI Baseball 3AA3A-AAH4Unrestricted substitutions for batting team
RBI Baseball 3ABAA-AAA0Unrestricted substitutions for fielding team (except pitchers)
RBI Baseball 4AK6T-AE9EMost home runs are counted as outs (turn this code on when the other team is at bat).
RBI Baseball 4AK7A-AE2NSome in-park hits are counted as home runs, or sometimes if a ball is hit out to left field, the ball will suddenly roll back to the infield all by itself.

Road Rash02PA-BH8LPlayer A starts with $623,900
Road RashNOTE: to get some of these test bikes (codes 63 to 77) to go , you have to just "tap" the "B" button while holding down the "A" button, then release them both, it takes a little practice. Also make sure you let the other riders have a head start, if you don't, you'll smash into them from behind! Using these bikes can sometimes cause the game to quit.

Road Rash IIFor Codes 44 thru 53, a player ordinarily must finish 3rd or better on each of the 5 tracks to qualify for advancement to the next level. These codes eliminate qualification requirements for particular tracks. They are for Solo and Take Turn modes, and sometimes will not work after playing in Split Screen or Mano-a-Mano modes. Also it doesn't say you have qualified on the track selection screen, but the codes work.
Road Rash IIAEST-AAERPlayer A pre-qualifies on Alaska track
Road Rash IIAEST-AAE0Player A pre-qualifies on Hawaii track
Road Rash IIAEST-AAE8Player A pre-qualifies on Tennessee track
Road Rash IIAEST-AAFGPlayer A pre-qualifies on Arizona track
Road Rash IIAEST-AAFRPlayer A pre-qualifies on Vermont track

Road Rash IIAETA-AAELPlayer B pre-qualifies on Hawaii track

Road Rash IIAETA-AAFCPlayer B pre-qualifies on Vermont track

Rolling Thunder 2ADZA-BE70Infinite flame thrower and shot cluster shots--both players
Rolling Thunder 2With Codes 62 and 63, special weapon shots can look funny and may have different degrees of effectiveness, depending on the round.
Rolling Thunder 2AXST-ANAEMake flame thrower special weapon in round 5, instead of shot cluster  (standing shots only--you still get shot cluster when you crouch)
Rolling Thunder 2SXSA-B4SY + A5SA-ANH0  Make shot cluster special weapon in all rounds instead of only in round 5   (standing shots only--you still get flame thrower when you crouch)
Rolling Thunder 2PZTT-AADTTimer runs at 1/10 normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2VBTT-AADTTimer runs at 1/8 normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2CFTT-ACDTTimer runs at 1/4 normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2PVTT-ACDTTimer runs at 1/3 normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2EKTT-AEDTTimer runs at 1/2 normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2VBTT-ATDTTimer runs at 2x normal speed
Rolling Thunder 23VTT-A2DTTimer runs at 3x normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2CBTT-BCDTTimer runs at 4x normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2EBTT-AEMTTimer runs at 8x normal speed
Rolling Thunder 2ZBTT-AYMTTimer runs at 10x normal speed

ShadowRunNOTE: These codes must be entered at the start of a new game. You can use all of the stat codes at the same time if you want, but it may make the Atk and Def meters look funny (because your stats will be so high).
ShadowRunDEYT-RAMJThe Samurai starts a new game with 25 ammo clips (instead of only 10).
ShadowRunGJYT-RAMJThe Samurai starts a new game with 50 ammo clips (instead of only 10).
ShadowRunBEYT-RCETThe Samurai starts a new game with 9 Body (instead of 4) and your Def and Magical defense goes up.
ShadowRunB6YT-R8EWThe Samurai starts a new game with 15 Quickness (instead of 3), and 15 Strength (instead of 4). Also, your Atk and Def goes up.
ShadowRunB6YT-R8EYThe Samurai starts a new game with 15 Charisma (instead of 1), and 15 Intelligence (instead of 2). Also, your Atk and Def goes up.
ShadowRunB6YT-RAE4The Samurai starts a new game with the Firearms stat at 15 (instead of 4). Also, your Atk goes way up.
ShadowRunBEYT-RWFGThe Samurai starts a new game with 9 Negotiation (instead of 1), and 9 Karma (instead of 0).

Shining ForceWith codes 152 to 159 you can only use one code for each item and most of these codes only work during battle.
Shining ForceCKNT-F0A8When you use the Medical Herb, EVERYONE in your party will have their HP restored!!
Shining ForceHBNT-F0A8When you use the Medical Herb, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Turbo Pepper!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining ForceHFNT-F0A8When you use the Medical Herb, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Bread of Life!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining ForceCKNT-F0BRWhen you use the Healing Seed, EVERYONE in your party will have their HP restored!!
Shining ForceHBNT-F0BRWhen you use the Healing Seed, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Turbo Pepper!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining ForceHFNT-F0BRWhen you use the Healing Seed, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Bread of Life!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining ForceWith codes 158 and 159, the Antidote will not cure poison while the code is turned on.
Shining ForceHBNT-F0B8When you use the Antidote, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Turbo Pepper!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining ForceHFNT-F0B8When you use the Antidote, EVERYONE in your party will receive the Bread of Life!! Repeat as many times as you want!
Shining Force93NT-F93EBuy "Medical Herb" with the code turned OFF for $10. Turn the code ON and sell the Medical Herb back for $49,150!
Shining ForceABNT-EABYHealing Seed is free (instead of $200).
Shining ForceABNT-EACEAntidote is free (instead of $20).
Shining ForceABNT-EADEAngel Wing is free (instead of $40).
Shining ForceABPA-EAHYShort Sword is free (instead of $100).

Shining ForceABPT-EABESteel Sword is free (instead of $2500).
Shining ForceABPT-EABYBroad Sword is free (instead of $4800).
Shining ForceABPT-EAHYSpear is free (instead of $150).
Shining ForceABPT-EAFEBronze Lance is free (instead of $300).
Shining ForceABRA-EAAEPower Spear is free (instead of $900).
Shining ForceABPT-EAGEChrome Lance is free (instead of $4500).
Shining ForceABRA-EABEHand Axe is free (instead of $200).
Shining ForceABPA-EAGYGreat Axe is free (instead of $10,000).
Shining ForceABRA-EADYWooden Staff is free (instead of $80).
Shining ForceABRA-EAFEPower Staff is free (instead of $500).
Shining ForceABRA-EAEYHoly Staff is free (instead of $8000).
Shining ForceABRA-EAGYWooden Arrows are free (instead of $320).
Shining ForceABRT-EAAEBuster Shot is free (instead of $12,400).
Shining ForceCodes 179 to 181 only work when starting a new game, and you can only use one of them at a time! Also since some of the higher level magic spells use lots of MP, you may want to also use code 6.
Shining Force3PJT-EBXWMax starts a new game with Egress 1, Heal 1, Heal 2, Heal 3, Heal 4, Bolt 1, Bolt 2, Bolt 3, and Bolt 4 magic spells!!
Shining Force3KJT-EDXWMax starts a new game with Egress 1, Aura 1, Aura 2, Aura 3, Aura 4, Freeze 1, Freeze 2, Freeze 3, and Freeze 4 magic spells!!
Shining Force2BJT-EXXWMax starts a new game with Egress 1, Blaze 1, Blaze 2, Blaze 3, Blaze 4, Heal 1, Heal 2, Heal 3, and Heal 4 magic spells!!
Shining ForceCodes 182 to 187 only work when starting a new game, and you can only use one of them at a time!
Shining Force97JT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword).
Shining ForceAFJT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword), and a Healing Seed.
Shining ForceAPJT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword), and the Shower of Cure.
Shining ForceBFJT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword), and the Bread of Life.
Shining ForceBBJT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword), and the Turbo Pepper.
Shining ForceS3JT-F9DRMax starts a new game with the Long Sword equipped (instead of the Middle sword), and the Buster Shot (you can sell the Buster Shot for $9300)
Shining ForceCodes 188 to 191 only work when starting a new game, and you can only use one of them at a time!
Shining ForceAFJT-ECDTMax starts a new game with 2 Healing Seeds (instead of nothing).
Shining ForceAPJT-EGDTMax starts a new game with 2 Shower of Cures (instead of nothing).
Shining ForceBFJT-EWDTMax starts a new game with 2 Bread of Lifes (instead of nothing).
Shining ForceS3JT-F65TMax starts a new game with 2 Buster Shots (instead of nothing).
Shining ForceWith Codes 192 to 198 keep in mind that the codes will also affect any enemy that uses that weapon as well.
Shining ForceFBPA-EAH6Makes the Middle Sword MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Middle Sword one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceFBPT-EAA6Makes the Steel Sword MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Steel Sword one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceEPPT-EAHNMakes the Spear MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Spear one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceEPPT-EAFNMakes the Steel Lance MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Steel Lance one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceEFRA-EAA6Makes the Hand Axe MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Hand Axe one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceEPRA-EADNMakes the Wooden Staff MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Wooden Staff one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining ForceEPRA-EAGNMakes the Wooden Arrow MUCH more powerful. This code makes the Wooden Arrow one of the strongest weapons in the game!
Shining Force II - Return of the KingCodes 1 to 4 only work during battle and are great for leveling-up very quickly! Don't combine these codes with other codes that modify the same item. And remember that the items won't do their normal function when the code is on.i.e. the Antidote won't cure poison with the code turned on (you will level-up instead)
Shining Force II - Return of the KingEV1A-CAPRWhen you use Magical Herbs, you will go up one level!
Shining Force II - Return of the KingEV1A-CAP8When you use Healing Seeds, you will go up one level!
Shining Force II - Return of the KingEV1A-CAR8When you use the Antidote, you will go up one level!
Shining Force II - Return of the KingEV1A-CAS8When you use Fairy Powder, you will go up one level!
Shining Force II - Return of the King973T-D926Sell the Wooden Sword for $49,151
Shining Force II - Return of the King973T-D996Buy a Wooden Rod for $60 with the code turned OFF, then turn the code ON and sell it back for $49,151. Repeat as often as you want!
Shining Force II - Return of the King971A-D97NBuy a Medical Herb for $10 with the code turned OFF, then turn the code ON and sell it back for about $49,000. Repeat as often as you want!
Shining Force II - Return of the KingAB1A-CAF6Healing Seed is free (instead of $200).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingAB1A-CAGNHealing Drop is free (instead of $300).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingAB1A-CAG6Antidote is free (instead of $20).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingAB1A-CAH6Fairy Powder is free (instead of $100).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingWith codes 12 to 17 you may have to unequip, and then equip, the weapon before the change will show. Keep in mind that the codes below will also affect any enemy that uses that weapon as well.
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK3T-CNBAMakes the Wooden Sword MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 3).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK3A-CNCAMakes the Short Sword MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 5).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK3T-CNBTMakes the Short Spear MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 6).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK2A-CNGAMakes the Short Axe MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 5).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK4A-CNAAMakes the Wooden Rod MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 3).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingFK4T-CNBAMakes the Short Knife MUCH stronger! (42 ATT instead of only 5).
Shining Force II - Return of the KingCodes 18 to 35 will let ANY character (even non-magic users) cast the spells shown, as long as you have the weapon. Keep in mind that the weapon may be damaged in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the KingThe weapon doesn't have to be equipped for the codes to work, but you can only use one code for each weapon.
Shining Force II - Return of the KingVP3T-CZA8The Wooden Sword casts a BLAZE 3 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z3T-CZA8The Wooden Sword casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F3T-CZA8The Wooden Sword casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).
Shining Force II - Return of the King3V3A-CZB8The Short Sword casts a FREEZE 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z3A-CZB8The Short Sword casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F3A-CZB8The Short Sword casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).

Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z3T-CZBRThe Short Spear casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F3T-CZBRThe Short Spear casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).
Shining Force II - Return of the King3V2A-CZF8The Short Axe casts a FREEZE 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z2A-CZF8The Short Axe casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F2A-CZF8The Short Axe casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).
Shining Force II - Return of the King3V3T-CZH8The Wooden Rod casts a FREEZE 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z3T-CZH8The Wooden Rod casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F3T-CZH8The Wooden Rod casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).
Shining Force II - Return of the King3V4T-CZA8The Short Knife casts a FREEZE 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King3Z4T-CZA8The Short Knife casts a BOLT 4 spell when used as an item in battle.
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F4T-CZA8The Short Knife casts a AURA 4 spell when used as an item in battle (everyones HP will be fully restored!!).
Shining Force II - Return of the King2F1A-CTPRUsing medical herb heals all HP of party

Shining in the DarknessNote: Codes 34 to 48 only work when you start a new game!

Shining in the DarknessWith codes 49 thru 52, the minister will say you received 200 gold pieces, but you will actually get the amount the code gives you, and the game will keep proper track of your total.

Sonic The HedgehogGJ6A-CA7AInfinite lives
Sonic The HedgehogWith Code 13 - Access the level select menu by holding down "A" while pressing Start. This MUST be done at the title screen, while Sonic is waving his finger! 
Sonic The HedgehogNOTE: Some Codes don't work if you start on a special stage using this code!

Sonic The HedgehogAEOT-CABY  Once you have shoes, keep shoes for the rest of stage or until you die

Sonic the Hedgehog 2Normally, you have to grab all seven chaos emeralds, 50 rings, and jump to turn into Super Sonic. With Codes 58 Thru 69, you can reduce the number of emeralds and rings you have to get.

StarflightNOTE: There are TWO versions of this game!
StarflightIf the "A" Codes don't work on your copy, then try the "B" Codes!

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionADBT-EJDESagat jumps backward much lower
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionADBT-ELDESagat jumps backward lower

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionADBT-EYDESagat jumps backward much higher

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionEDBT-ECEABalrog jumps backward not as far

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionADBT-EYEN + ADBT-EYEYBalrog jumps up much higher

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCodes 216 Thru 221 work for Ryu's Fireball, Guile's Sonic Boom, Ken's Fireball, Chun Li's Fireball, & Dhalsim's Yoga Fire & Yoga Flame. Sagat's Tiger shot must be changed with codes 254 thru 258.
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionLDBA-F13ELight fireballs go faster
Street Fighter II Special Championship Edition4XBA-F73ELight fireballs go slower
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionLDBA-F13GMedium fireballs go faster
Street Fighter II Special Championship Edition4XBA-F73GMedium fireballs go slower
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionLDBA-F13JHard fireballs go faster
Street Fighter II Special Championship Edition4XBA-F73JHard fireballs go slower
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionFor Codes 222 Thru 258, "Faster" may also mean "Father" or "Harder", and "Slower" may also mean "Not as far" or "Softer".
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCCFT-CWC4Edmond Honda's light sumo head butts are faster
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCCFT-CGC4Edmond Honda's light sumo head butts are slower
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCCFT-CWC6Edmond Honda's medium sumo head butts are faster
Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCCFT-CGC6Edmond Honda's medium sumo head butts are slower

Street Fighter II Special Championship EditionCCFT-CGC8Edmond Honda's hard sumo head butts are slower

Super Street Fighter II - The New ChallengersCodes 15 and 16 don't work for computer controlled characters.

Tommy Lasorda BaseballNOTE: there are 2 versions of this game. If the"A" Codes do not work, then try the "B" Codes.
Tommy Lasorda BaseballUnless otherwise noted, all codes below apply to both players.
Tommy Lasorda Baseball"A" Codes
Tommy Lasorda BaseballAAEA-AAAA + AAEA-AACC + ACPA-AAHYRegulation game lasts 1 inning
Tommy Lasorda BaseballAEEA-AAAA + AEEA-AACC + AGPA-AAHYRegulation game lasts 2 innings
Tommy Lasorda BaseballAJEA-AAAA + AJEA-AACC + ALPA-AAHYRegulation game lasts 3 innings
Tommy Lasorda BaseballATEA-AAAA + ATEA-AACC + AWPA-AAHYRegulation game lasts 5 innings
Tommy Lasorda BaseballA2EA-AAAA + A2EA-AACC + A4PA-AAHYRegulation game lasts 7 innings

Tommy Lasorda BaseballRHVA-A6WJ + A5VA-BE4LPitches use more energy
Tommy Lasorda BaseballRHVA-A6WJ + CDVA-BE4LPitches use much more energy
Tommy Lasorda BaseballBMVA-AA4WPitches use no energy
Tommy Lasorda BaseballAJ3T-AAD2Batter walks on 2 balls
Tommy Lasorda BaseballAN3T-AAD2Batter walks on 3 balls
Tommy Lasorda BaseballFor Codes 12 and 13, only 4 balls are displayed on screen, but you will still have the larger number.

Tommy Lasorda BaseballA23T-AAD2Batter walks on 6 balls

Tommy Lasorda Baseball4A3T-AA5LAny pitch taken is a strike

Tommy Lasorda BaseballAXPA-AA4YFoul bunt after 2 strikes is not an out
